intro: A cozy, first person metal detector adventure game, where you reunite residents of the beautiful Cornish island of Glasden with things they have lost.
description:
Relax, explore and experience that childlike sense of wonder as you skip around the island. Traverse the island at your own pace, steadily solving the mystery your Grandpa couldn’t.

Each of the residents of Glasden has objects they have lost, and Morgan must search the island with her metal detector to find these lost treasures. Each of these quests asks you to engage and really think about the potential location of the lost item. On returning, each of these characters rewards Morgan with a unique cassette tape which you can listen to whilst you’re exploring. This music and the detailed audio soundscape throughout Glasden helps to place you in this magical environment. Lose yourself in the quests and lovely audio. 

As you explore the island using your trusty metal detector, you will find many types of items hidden underground. You can take these items to Cenna’s shop, exchange them for credits and purchase new sticker packs and film for your instant camera. You can then decorate the journal with these stickers and the photos you’ve taken. Express yourself in the in-game journal.

The game features a brilliant original score and fantastic voice acting, featuring BAFTA nominated Charlotte McBurney as the titular Morgan, who voices Amicia in the A Plague Tale series of games. 

Features
- Search the island for buried treasure with your metal detector
- Things are going missing on the island! Follow clues and help people locate their lost items
- Meet the island’s charming inhabitants
- Explore the beautiful scenery at your own pace
- Listen to music on your tape player, unlock new tapes by completing quests
- Take pictures of your favourite views using your instant camera
- Customise your journal with stickers and photos from your instant camera
- Trade unwanted items in at the shop to buy more film for your instant camera and sticker packs to put in your journal
- Solve the mystery at the heart of the island
